title: Complaining about blocked bike lanes
context: Complain that a delivery truck is parked directly in the bicycle lane.

content.bestLine: There's a delivery truck parked in the bike lane

neutral.text: The bike lane is blocked by a truck
A delivery truck is in the way
There's a vehicle in the bike lane
The lane is blocked by a parked truck
A truck is parked in the bike lane
A delivery vehicle is in the bike lane

informal.text: Dude, there's a truck in the bike lane
There's a truck parked in our lane
Someone's parked in the bike lane
The bike lane is all blocked up
A truck's in the way, man
We can't get through, there's a truck
There's a delivery truck in our path

slang.text: Yo, truck's in the bike lane, fam
Truck's all up in our grill
Someone's all up in our lane
We can't even get through, it's whack

rude.text: Get your truck out of our lane
What's wrong with you, parking in the bike lane?
This isn't a parking lot, move your truck
Are you kidding me, truck in the bike lane?
Get out of our way, truck

patterns.template: There's a [options] in the bike lane
patterns.meaning: Something is blocking the bike lane

patterns.template: The bike lane is blocked by a [options]
patterns.meaning: The bike lane is obstructed by something

dialogs.description: Two friends complaining about a blocked bike lane

lines.speaker: Friend 1
lines.text: Dude, there's a truck in the bike lane

lines.speaker: Friend 2
lines.text: I know, right? It's so annoying

dialogs.description: A cyclist complaining to a driver about a blocked bike lane

lines.speaker: Cyclist
lines.text: You're parked in the bike lane, can you move?

lines.speaker: Driver
lines.text: Oh, sorry about that. I didn't see it
